Rva.C

00001 
00002 // Relative Virtual Addresses (RVA)
00003 // An RVA is always relative to the base virtual address (base_va) defined in an executable file header.
00004 // A rose_rva_t is optionally tied to an SgAsmGenericSection so that if the preferred mapped address of the section is
00005 // modified then the RVA stored in the rose_rva_t object is also adjusted.  The section-relative offset is always treated as
00006 // an unsigned quantity, but negative offsets can be accommodated via integer overflow.
00007 //
00008 // Be careful about adjusting the RVA (the address or section) using ROSETTA's accessors.
00009 //     symbol.p_address.set_section(section);          // this works
00010 //     symbol.get_address().set_section(section);      // using ROSETTA accessor modifies a temporary copy of the RVA
00011 // But if ROSETTA returns a vector then we can modify the RVA:
00012 //     symbol.p_addresses[0].set_section(section);     // this works
00013 //     symbol.get_addresses()[0].set_section(section); // so does this.
00015 
00016 #include "sage3basic.h"
00017 
00018 rose_addr_t
00019 rose_rva_t::get_rva() const 
00020 {
00021     rose_addr_t rva = addr;
00022     if (section) rva += section->get_mapped_preferred_rva();
00023     return rva;
00024 }
00025 
00026 rose_rva_t&
00027 rose_rva_t::set_rva(rose_addr_t rva)
00028 {
00029     addr = rva;
00030     if (section)
00031         addr -= section->get_mapped_preferred_rva();
00032     return *this;
00033 }
00034 
00035 SgAsmGenericSection *
00036 rose_rva_t::get_section() const
00037 {
00038     return section;
00039 }
00040 
00041 rose_rva_t&
00042 rose_rva_t::set_section(SgAsmGenericSection *new_section)
00043 {
00044     if (section) {
00045         addr += section->get_mapped_preferred_rva();
00046         section = NULL;
00047     }
00048     if (new_section) {
00049         addr -= new_section->get_mapped_preferred_rva();
00050     }
00051     section = new_section;
00052     return *this;
00053 }
00054 
00055 /* Set the section to the section that best (most specifically) describes the virtual address */
00056 rose_rva_t&
00057 rose_rva_t::bind(SgAsmGenericHeader *fhdr)
00058 {
00059     rose_addr_t va = get_rva() + fhdr->get_base_va();
00060     SgAsmGenericSection *secbind = fhdr->get_best_section_by_va(va, true);
00061     return set_section(secbind);
00062 }
00063 
00064 /* Return address relative to currently bound section */
00065 rose_addr_t
00066 rose_rva_t::get_rel() const
00067 {
00068     return addr;
00069 }
00070 
00072 rose_addr_t
00073 rose_rva_t::get_rel(SgAsmGenericSection *s)
00074 {
00075     ROSE_ASSERT(s!=NULL);
00076     ROSE_ASSERT(s->is_mapped());
00077     ROSE_ASSERT(get_rva() >= s->get_mapped_preferred_rva());
00078     return get_rva() - s->get_mapped_preferred_rva();
00079 }
00080 
00084 rose_addr_t
00085 rose_rva_t::get_va() const
00086 {
00087     if (!section)
00088         return addr;
00089     ROSE_ASSERT(section->is_mapped());
00090     return addr + section->get_mapped_preferred_rva() + section->get_base_va();
00091 }
00092 
00094 std::string
00095 rose_rva_t::to_string() const
00096 {
00097     char s[1024];
00098     sprintf(s, "0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64")", get_rva(), get_rva());
00099     std::string ss = s;
00100 
00101     if (get_section()) {
00102         sprintf(s, " + 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64")", get_rel(), get_rel());
00103         ss += " <" + get_section()->get_name()->get_string(true) + s + ">";
00104     }
00105     return ss;
00106 }

00109 void
00110 rose_rva_t::increment(rose_addr_t amount)
00111 {
00112     addr += amount;
00113 }

00115 std::ostream &
00116 operator<<(std::ostream &os, const rose_rva_t &rva)
00117 {
00118     os << rva.to_string();
00119     return os;

00122 /* Arithmetic */
00123 rose_addr_t operator+(const rose_rva_t &a1, const rose_rva_t &a2) {return a1.get_rva() + a2.get_rva();}
00124 rose_addr_t operator-(const rose_rva_t &a1, const rose_rva_t &a2) {return a1.get_rva() - a2.get_rva();}
00125 
00126 /* Comparisons */
00127 bool operator< (const rose_rva_t &a1, const rose_rva_t &a2) {return a1.get_rva() <  a2.get_rva();}
00128 bool operator<=(const rose_rva_t &a1, const rose_rva_t &a2) {return a1.get_rva() <= a2.get_rva();}
00129 bool operator> (const rose_rva_t &a1, const rose_rva_t &a2) {return a1.get_rva() >  a2.get_rva();}
00130 bool operator>=(const rose_rva_t &a1, const rose_rva_t &a2) {return a1.get_rva() >= a2.get_rva();}
00131 bool operator==(const rose_rva_t &a1, const rose_rva_t &a2) {return a1.get_rva() == a2.get_rva();}
00132 bool operator!=(const rose_rva_t &a1, const rose_rva_t &a2) {return a1.get_rva() != a2.get_rva();}
